text.Contract title and description: PROJ10028: Better Assistance in Crises (BASIC) Research
text.KPI name and description:
Quality of products
Products are delivered following relevant IDS quality assurance and signed off by FCDO SRO. Four criteria:
1) BASIC Research has submitted evidence of responses to:
a. 2 internal reviews of products (at least 1 reviewer with 10+ years experience)
b. 1 external review of products (at least 5+ years experience, but preferably more)
Product then submitted to FCDO as part of quarterly report usually on the final day of the quarter. 
Steps 2, 3 and 4 to occur after that deadline.
2) BASIC Research has responded to FCDO reviews
3) FCDO deems the product to be within the agreed* scope in terms of planned purpose and content
4) FCDO signs off the product
text.Good target: When FCDO signs off the product the full amount of funds linked to that product will be released.

text.Contract title and description: BATUK Aviation - Lot One MEDEVAC
text.KPI name and description: Ground Ambulance – Helicopter Landing Site (HLS) Response. The Supplier shall ensure one available and reliable ground ambulance is available 24/7/365. To be deemed available and reliable the ground ambulance shall meet the response times as per the Statement of Requirement (SoR) and be situated at the designated landing site ready to conduct takeover of the patient from the air MEDEVAC platform to the Aga Khan Hospital, be suitably equipped and configured to continue patient care with a communication system as per the SoR, be manned by a minimum of one qualified person in pre emergency care to Level 5, be able to transfer the patient and continue care in the correct configuration, be a fully serviceable ground ambulance maintained and operated within Kenyan Road Transport Regulations and be driven by a competent driver backed up with a trained mechanic and despatch team.
text.Good target: The ground ambulance is at the Helicopter Landing Site (HLS) to meet the air MEDEVAC platform and successfully hands over the patient as confirmed by the Medical Liaison Officer.

text.Contract title and description: Facilities Management - UK Europe
text.KPI name and description:
SY M1  
The Contractor will provide the services in compliance with Security requirements and as defined and set out in the Contract Agreement (including the Service Information) 
No Material failure of the Service Provider or any Contracting Associates to comply with the Authority security requirements as set out in the Contract Agreement (inc the Service Information).
Information confirmed by Estate Operations Team
text.Comments:
Further to CO meetings and Training we have reviewed the data provided in this return to ensure that it reflects the 4 Management Indicators that are most important the the FCDO.  This has been based on the 3 Nominated MIs in the APac contract and the delivery of PPMs ensuring a safe and compliant Estate. 

A full contract Deep Dive is currently underway in collaboration with Mitie, with various areas of the contract under scrutiny by FCDO and Cabinet Office officials.  

SY 01 is currently subject to intense scrutiny by the Deep Dive and a full action plan is in place to correct the security breaches identified by FCDO Estate Operations Team as well as other issues.  These have been rectified from Month 2 of this return

text.Contract title and description: DIO Strategic Property Advisor (Lot 2).
text.KPI name and description: Commercial and Estates Project Manager (PM) will investigate the invoices against forecasting reports to see where forecasted spend is being achieved or has not be met. Supplier to provide an explanation on those targets that will not be met for the month. 'Invoiced' counts as actual work forecasted and completed.
text.Comments:
AY have provided comments to Defence Infrastructure Organisation (DIO) previously about the difficulty in providing accurate fee forecasts. We have outlined some of the main reasons for this below:
-          Scoring is based on forecasts provided 5-6 weeks in advance of actual invoicing and therefore is a high level estimate at the time.
Actual fees invoiced are reflective of the work undertaken, mostly on a time-charge basis, and this may be more or less than forecast.AV131
-          Reactive nature of AY’s consultancy work on all of the SPA sites means AY cannot predict when we may need to undertake work and therefore invoice. This can change significantly on a week to week basis and reflects AY’s instructions from DIO case officers.
-          Time taken for DIO approval process for both obtaining a PO and approval of submitting invoices impacts when AY can actually invoice.

text.Comments: Post Office Ltd (POL) introduce their tablet solution for processing “Ten Year Renewals” transactions earlier this year where they take a photo at the counter.  The errors have increased which is due to the quality of photos being sent through.  Regular meetings between DVLA and POL are taking place with a technical fix by POL due to be implemented before Christmas.  This should see the number of errors reduce and the KPI return to more acceptable measures.

text.Contract title and description: ROTARY WING SUPPORT TO THE BRITISH ARMY TRAINING SUPPORT UNIT WITH THE BRUNEI GARRISON ALONG WITH SUPPORTING UK BASED AIRCREW TRAINING REQUIREMENT
text.KPI name and description:
Availability in Middle Wallop
KPI 2 refers to Planned Tasks in Middle Wallop. The intention of KPI 2 is to focus the Contractor’s behaviour on effectively managing and maintaining the fleet to ensure aircraft availability, in the correct configuration, pursuant to the Statement of Requirement when used in Middle Wallop. The Contractor should anticipate and manage risks or issues without unnecessarily seeking intervention from the Authority.

text.Contract title and description: PROJ10011 Independent evaluation contract for the Girls’ Education Challenge Fund Phase II (GEC II)
text.KPI name and description:
Provider actively captures and shares lessons learned on own performance and has sought to improve on the last reporting period's performance.
Percentage of KPI is measured by taking in consideration supplier’s achievement in quarterly scoring system done by FCDO: 
• 6 = 100% Outstanding delivery with innovation and outstanding execution, well exceeding contractual requirements.
• 5 = 83% Proactive supplier delivering efficiently and effectively above contractual expectations.
• 4 = 66% Supplier delivering efficiently and effectively. Very few or no improvements needed.
• 3 = 50% Most responsibilities are delivered efficiently and effectively. Some improvements should be made.
• 2 = 33% Some criteria met but significant improvements needed.
1 = 16% Serious under performance. Not meeting requirements. Immediate and major changes needed
– KPI description is a summarised version of a more detailed indicator embedded in the contract

KPI3
 Financial management- Accuracy of timely forecasting and invoice Dec-Feb 2022:
•	Accurate and timely submission of forecasting and reporting of monthly spend within 10% variance to FCDO by 26th of each month with justification for variances above 10%. 
•	Supplier provides timely (within 72 hours) initial response to any FCDO questions concerning the financial deliverables including invoices. 
•	Ensure supplier invoice includes all the required information accurately and is submitted together with the quarterly narrative report two weeks after end of quarter.
Good: Variance <10% 
Approaching target: Variance <15%
Requires improvement: Variance >15%
Inadequate: Variance >20%

text.Contract title and description: Lafiya Contract: UK Support for Health in Nigeria
text.KPI name and description:
2. Proportion of States with Functional Logistics Management Coordinating Units (LMCU) 

Scoring: LMCUs are considered to be operational if they are regularly performing their roles and responsibilities as outlined in the National Health Product Supply Chain Strategic Development and Implementation Plan (2021-2025). At the state level, LMCUs are expected to develop and implement an integrated health commodity forecasting and distribution plan and to cascade the LMCU structures at LGA level.
Scoring is determined on the basis of supplier performance in FCDO's Annual Supplier Scorecards which has a percentage scoring system will incur a 'good' rating if more than 80%, whilst scores of 50-79% approaching target; 30-49% will require improvement and <30% will incur an 'inadequate' rating.
